data.title: Looked nice, but......
data.text: I heard good things about Biagio's and knew they had live music.  It seemed like a good date night location.  It looked nice on the inside, not too crowded, but we sat there for fifteen minutes and were ignored by the wait staff.  We gave up, left, and chose another place to go.  May be nice, but they obviously didn't want our business, so I gave them a one.  Hopefully you will have better luck.

data.title: Great Date Night
data.text: Get the mozzarella sticks, trust me. The burgers and specials are wonderful. The desserts are amazing. Trivia night is a lot of fun for the perfect date night.

data.title: Dinner and Trivia
data.text: My husband and I visit Biagio's every Thursday evening to enjoy Trivia night! While Biagio's is a Coffee & Espresso Bar, they also offer amazing dinner options for guests. The Biagio chefs adjust the menu from time to time in order to make room for new and exciting items! Their burgers are some of the best in Jacksonville, NC with their blends of flavor and appropriate seasoning. The Stephano Burger is one of my personal favorites! Appetizers you won't find anywhere else include Buffalo Cauliflower Bites which are an awesome replacement for boneless buffalo wings. From the trivia to the mouth watering food, I enjoy spending my time at Biagio's once a week!

data.title: Espresso please, not coffee...
data.text:
The Barista tried hard, VERY hard, 3 times. But all that came out of the espresso machine was watery coffee...
Now either the machine needs re-adjustment, or they use the wrong beans/grind them wrong, or the Barista needs to practice more.
No reason to stop, detour or whatsoever when in need for a real espresso.
The place looked nice by the way.

data.title: So good I went every morning on my visit
data.text: We walked in the first time in the later afternoon and they were busy. We were a minute away from leaving when a gentlemen wearing a Cleveland Cavs hat walked over and apologized for the delay. We are really happy he stopped us. My wife and I both had the Italian Latte. We walked to our cars and took the first sip and were amazed with how smooth and good this coffee tasted. I was beyond happy that after a long vacation of traveling and getting substandard coffee that Biagio's exceeded the expectations I had for AMAZING coffee. So good in fact that after that first visit on the 13th we returned on the 14th and delayed our drive out to match up with when they opened on the 15th. We didn't even have to consider trying anywhere else. When you are looking for great coffee and find a good place, just stop and we did.

data.title: Great food and service. Real down to earth folks
data.text:
Saw newspaper ad. Led me to a facebook post. Wednesday special was. $6.95 Chicken or pork both were great.
Phil the manager was great. Very friendly and outgoing. 
Martin the owner was attentive and outgoing too. Both great guys
I had Pork; Tenderloin with Julienne vegetables and Garlic Mash Potatoes comes in a great tasting sauce
My wife had Chicken Rollatini: Mozzarella, Spinach and Prosciutto. Rolled up in a chicken breast and served in white wine sauce. These specials usually sell for $14 to $16. Due to it being a special it was only $6.95 but I would pay full price any time.
If you are a Marine at Camp LeJeune, or a local Jacksonville Resident. You owe it to yourself to eat here at least once.
Eat there once, I BET YOU WILL EAT THERE AGAIN.
My wife just told me we are eating there next week!
Thank you Phil and Martin (and the cook) for a great eating experience!
Below I said mid range on price but, the specials tonight I would say cheap eats. But still Outstanding food!

data.title: Food was good, service was ok
data.text: So we ordered a bunch of apps as our meal and shared. I was there on business with me relator. The food was good, filling, and too much for me! Lol we had leftovers. The service was slow, and at best, lacking. I expected a typical, friendly, mid afternoon waitress and we got someone who was slow and who couldn't answer questions without asking the chef.

data.title: Lunch visit
data.text: Stopped by for a quick bite. I had a cappuccino, which was fine. I also sampled the bruschetta, which had a LOT of cheese and perhaps too much pesto and balsamic. It was good, but overwhelming.

data.title: I Loved This Place
data.text: I have been twice for lunch and once just to get coffee.  The food, coffee, staff and atmosphere are all superb.  If you haven't been down to the old part of Jacksonville, where Biagio's is located, you should.  There is a nice Southern charm to the buildings.  Biagio's is also a block or so from the river if you'd like to walk down and see some great views.

data.title: Great place to meet friends
data.text: I enjoyed a delicious (and different) breakfast with a friend. The atmosphere is upscale with prices that are "normal" for our area. This is a great addition to our downtown's goal to bring back the downtown area. I encourage our residents to visit.

data.title: Best Coffee Around
data.text: This is by far the best coffee shop around. I visit Biagio's almost weekly with my wife and/or my family to get coffee. The atmosphere is great, the baristas are great and if you're hungry they have great food too.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: I had been to Biagio's a few months ago for coffee with a friend who loves the place. Service was great, nice atmosphere. Today I took my family, visiting from out of town, for lunch. I arrived at 12:40, our food didn't come until 1:27. The place wasn't crowded. A table of 5 was behind us and a table of two across from us. Ours was a party of 7. We ordered burgers and sandwiches and a small pizza for the 2 children, nothing that should take that long to arrive. Our food was pretty good, no complaints with the burgers, sandwiches were okay and house fries were cold and not good. I do like to try local places and support small businesses, this was a let down. I won't recommend this restaurant. I was embarrassed I chose it for my out-of-town guests.

data.title: Frequent Customer
data.text: My husband and I love to go to Biagio's. The service and the food are always the best. I always get a white chocolate Mocha with whip cream! So yummy. We love going on Mondays when it is buy 1 coffee drink get one free.

data.title: Food good,  service horrible
data.text: Went with a group of friends this past weekend. Live music - which was good, just a little too loud for where it was. Food was good, except for the cherry/orange cronut..the filling was strange. The waitress was the worse part. My husband asked for a beer and it took him a good 20 minutes to get it;and that was asking for it a 2nd time. One member of our group had to go pay at the front because the waitress was not being attentive. (They also asked for more water but never got it). I realize she could have been new, however she shouldn't be left alone if she can not handle the environment. I will go back to give it another shot.

data.title: First time visit
data.text: Nice ambiance. Nice, quaint elegance for a coffe shop style place. Wait staff was very attentive. Food was good.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: I've dined here many times and the food is always great. Great place to stop after work for drinks also. The building is beautiful. They are paving the way to revitalizing downtown Jacksonville.

data.title: Great lunch spot!
data.text:
My friend recommended this place for a recent girls day. I was a bit reluctant since the last restaurant we tried by the court house was terrible but she said coffee so I was there. I was extremely happy that I did give it a chance! 

The servers were very laid back and friendly. They were able to describe everything on the menu and make recommendations. I have the quesadilla and my friend had the turkey, bacon sandwich. Both were delicious! 

The location is okay but only because it's Jacksonville. The area could be so much more (i.e. shops, restaurants) but it's a bit rundown. The building itself is very cute, large windows and lots of light, parking is around back. I will definitely be back!

data.title: Amazing find in Jacksonville!
data.text: Authentic Italian eats - Cauli cakes are to die for! Caprese sandwich was made with fresh basil - delicious! Had an almond joy latte with ice cubes made out of coffee!  Nice piazza seating area. I'm definitely going back every day!

data.title: All Around Great Experience
data.text: The atmosphere was very inviting and friendly. It was not busy when we visited,  but we were there at the odd hours between lunch and dinner. Very nice decor. The burger I ordered was soooo delicious. Bite after bite was savory and is highly recommended. The flat bread pizza was also very tasty. Both meals were also presented very well. The only thing not 5 star in my opinion was the sweet tea. Just wasn't sweet enough for us.

data.title: Great, tasty lunch!
data.text:
Its so nice to finally have another locally-owned restaurant in Jacksonville that's not a dive! Several people had recommended Biagio's and I finally was able to have lunch there today. Their menu is really much more extensive than what you would think based on the name - plenty to choose from, not just coffee. Everything on the menu sounded delicious, but I settled on the caprese burger with "caulicakes." (Think of the consistency of a crab cake, but made with ground cauliflower and Italian seasonings.) Burger was served medium, topped with pesto, arugula, and heirloom tomatoes. So delicious! 
 
Can't wait to go back! Our very nice waitress mentioned live music and drink specials during the week, so I'm in!
